title: Final Inspiration keystone revealed, "Looter"

embed.description: They talked about this on the stream so to recap "Coming Soon": Looter - attacking an enemy grants bonus gold and a chance at a consumable https://t.co/cWPIfyaH1w

body:
"They talked about this on the stream so to recap "Coming Soon":
Looter - attacking an enemy grants bonus gold and a chance at a consumable"

replies.body:
Few more details:

* This works like Sheen - after you use a spell your next auto attack gets bonuses.
* At present those bonuses are slightly increased AA range (50 for ranged/125 for melee), gold generation on hit (like Spellthief's) and a small chance to get a consumable item (could be a health pot, a mana pot, or occasionally, late game in particularly, something like an Oracle's Elixir or Elixir of skill).
* Looter (not final name) is still more work in progress than other keystones, so details will change more. It'll hit PBE tomorrow, but balance will probably be off and there'll almost certainly be some noticeable bugs still with it.

By "a small chance to get a consumable", you are referrering to a pseudo-RNG effect, aren't you? While its not something that I see being as immediately impactful and thus complained about as Critical Strike, I don't feel like the addition of any RNG effect to the game is a good idea, especially since almost all such effects have been removed (with the only notable exception, Crit, being much complained about). Have you considered any other mechanism for granting the consumable, such as having them drop every Xth Looter proc?

Yes, a pseudo RNG effect, with the pseudo part controlling extremes for any particular game. We like the variation that getting power at somewhat different and not completely predictable times adds. Crit chance is problematic because there's nothing to do about, beyond hope you crit/don't get crit. Looter by contrast has its power offered through items you have to use, that will offer power over a period of time rather than a burst of instant damage, so there should be a lot more play both for the user and other players.

While I understand the appeal of varience in reward timings, there will still be times when the RNG of when and/or what consumable drops could dictate a fight. For example, getting a health pot off a proc at the beginning of a fight vs at the end, or a health pot rather than a mana pot. That 150 HP could be the difference between winning and losing a close fight. If you're the one losing a fight you should have won because your opponent happened to get a health pot off a looter proc at the beginning of a fight, or if an enemy survives ignite off such a pot, you're going to feel cheated the same way you do when a 20% crit Draven crits you twice and you die. You wouldn't feel cheated if that HP Pot was something that was timed/on a set cadence, because then the opponent knew they were getting it and could play knowing they had a surprise extra 150HP.

I see this more like a non keystone rune, otherwise all healing supports will lose their "windspeaker" if they have to choose this to get gold instead.

I love the idea, but for the life of me, I can't feel good about my choices here. 

My core problem with setting it as a keystone is that, as someone who plays support, it would feel _**bad**_ to have to forego what seems like two well fitting options for supportive casters and tanks in two trees respectively, buffing your own shields as an enchanter and giving you shields as a tank, as much more team oriented runes to take what could inevitably be a core for supports on the sheer fact that it's one of maybe 2 non-farming/kill oriented gold runes, and that my gold generation will be gimped unless I forego the more team oriented rune. 

It sort of brings to mind the illusion of choice, as while other classes get these options based on flexible core picks in their given tree, **it feels like if Looter must be made a keystone, then it really cuts off the strategic aspect.** I understand that it had to be somewhere and that Inspiration couldn't have _all_ the utility, it'd at least feel nicer to have Guardian or Aerie in the same build as the Bread & Butter for supports.

That brings to mind a another question: with the removal of gp10 runes and re-working of Bandit into Looter as it is, will there be any buffs to the gold generation for support items/supports in general? It might get dicey like how {{item:3303}} became something for midlaners for a while.
